title: Expressing Feelings and Opinions
description: Practice expressing emotions, opinions, and reporting what others have said.

sentences.text: I really appreciate everything you've done for me.
sentences.translation: 당신이 저를 위해 해주신 모든 것에 정말 감사해요.

sentences.text: I'm sorry, I think there's been a misunderstanding.
She told me that she was thinking about changing jobs.
sentences.tips: 간접화법을 사용해서 다른 사람의 말을 전달하세요.

sentences.text: Could you please explain what you mean by that?
sentences.tips: 'Could you please'로 공손하게 요청하세요. 의문문 억양으로 끝내세요.

sentences.text: I feel hurt when you don't listen to my opinion.
He asked me if I could help him with the project.
sentences.translation: 그가 프로젝트를 도와줄 수 있냐고 물었어요.

sentences.text: I completely understand your point of view.
In my opinion, communication is the key to a good relationship.
sentences.translation: 제 생각에는, 소통이 좋은 관계의 열쇠예요.

sentences.text: I didn't mean to upset you. Let me explain.
sentences.translation: 기분 나쁘게 하려던 게 아니에요. 설명할게요.

sentences.text: She suggested that we should meet more often.
I value our friendship and don't want to lose it.
sentences.translation: 우리 우정을 소중히 여기고 잃고 싶지 않아요.

sentences.text: Can we talk about what happened? I'd like to clear things up.
sentences.translation: 무슨 일이 있었는지 얘기할 수 있을까요? 오해를 풀고 싶어요.

lines.text: Ben, I need to talk to you about something.
I heard that you told Chris I wasn't interested in the project.
That's not exactly what I said. I think there's been a misunderstanding.
Then what did you say? Because Chris told me that you said I didn't care.
I said you were really busy lately, not that you didn't care. I'm sorry if it came across wrong.
I see. In the future, could you please let me speak for myself?
You're right. I apologize. I should have been more careful with my words.
I appreciate you understanding. I value our working relationship.
So do I. Thanks for coming to me directly to discuss this.
